intro: Phanera kostermansii, commonly known as the Kostermans' phanera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
